Recticel Sp. z o.o.
Recticel is an international industrial player with an ambitious goal: to take the daily experience of comfort to a new level of quality and innovation. We rely on our expertise in the transformation of polyurethane to meet customer and societal challenges responsibly.
Recticel is a Belgian Group with a strong European dimension, but it also operates in the rest of the world. Recticel (excluding minority stakes in joint ventures) employs 4,221 people in 41 establishments in 20 countries.
Recticel contributes to daily comfort with high performance insulation solutions, foam filling for seats, mattresses and slat bases of top brands and an extensive range of other industrial and domestic applications.
Within Recticelâ€™s Insulation segment, the high-quality thermal insulation products are marketed under the well-known brands EurowallÂ®, PowerroofÂ®, PowerdeckÂ®, PowerwallÂ® and XentroÂ®. Recticel is also the Group behind the bedding brands (BekaÂ®, LattoflexÂ®, Literie BultexÂ®, SchlaraffiaÂ®, SembellaÂ®, SwissflexÂ®, SuperbaÂ®, etc.) and GELTEXÂ®.

duties: Manage and coordinate product/platform development by connecting Product Owner and development team on IS Supplier side by undertaking numerous actions and activities during Sprint developments.
Manage product roadmap and backlog on behalf and with support of a Product Owner by co-leading ongoing reviews of demand from ABB.
Collect and rationalize business requirements from different stakeholders and bringing them together as product roadmap.
Document system requirements at both high and low levels, by producing proper documentation and accurate process and data flow diagrams
Review and approve deliverables from IS Supplier by attending demo sessions as a closure of each Sprint cycle.
Participate and improve Agile/SCRUM processes with continuous improvement culture within the team, by self-development and following best industry standards.

requirements: IT Professional with 3yrs+ experience in the relevant area of web communication platforms, applications.
Profound understanding of modeling methods, mapping business processes and creation of user stories and features. Nice to have is experience with tools like: Jira, Azure DevOps and similar.
Analyzing business processes, translating them into web components, functionalities, features and sharing recommendations with wider audience and other stakeholders.
Experience in working with different business stakeholders.
Experience in working in Scrum/Agile team.
Experience in working with complex and enterprise Content Management Systems
Knowledge and experience of ITIL foundations (preferably ITIL v.4)

Knowledge about web development best practices especially in the area of user experience in web communication portals, enhanced with knowledge of Web Security, GDPR, SEO. Knowledge of Adobe marketing, commerce and web content management systems are nice to have.
Backlog management and ability to organize work of development teams according to AGILE work culture.
Co-organization of sprints with IS Supplier, accepting demo, signing off developments and presenting deliverables to Product Owner(s) and other stakeholders.
Practice in facilitation of stakeholder meetings and stakeholders management.
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills (English C1 is expected)
Ability to handle multiple activities in a short timeline and tight deadlines.
A team player with service oriented mindset, that can work with little supervision.

duties: You will be part of our R&D team in Hitachi Energy Technology Center. Our cross-functional SAFe/Agile teams are developing End-to-End solutions including: hardware, FPGA and embedded software in close collaboration with the global organization. Now we are looking for enthusiasts who would like to strengthen our team.
As a programmer at MACH Software Development within HVDC, you will be involved in development and maintenance, from pre-study and design to tests and integration.
In our projects, you will work closely with both external and internal contacts.

Together with your highly competent colleagues you will develop and maintain the MACH platform. You will further develop your skills within programming, both by taking part in, and contributing to, our great talent pool.
We offer an exciting job in an international environment where you will get great possibilities to develop further within Hitachi Energy.
Living Hitachi Energyâ€™s core values of safety and integrity, which means taking responsibility for your own actions while caring for your colleagues and the business.
requirements: You have a genuine interest in computers, programming and new technology combined with several yearsâ€™ experience from similar work (we are going to extend our team by few engineers, so donâ€™t be afraid if you are Junior, Regular or Senior).
A bachelorâ€™s or masterâ€™s degree within Embedded Systems, Computer Science, Data Communications is highly qualifying. However, the most important is your experience and interest.
A solid understanding of C/C++.
Experience from embedded software development and real time operating systems.
Advantageous if you also have experience in .NET and software development using Visual Studio, data communications, SQL and TFS.
Experience in FPGA/VHDL and scripting languages like Perl and Python is an added advantage too.
As you will be part of a global business, fluency in English is required, written and spoken alike.
offered: Life insurance.
Flexible work practices.
Gym membership.
Medical insurance.

CONDUENT
Located in Lodz, Conduent is excited to be launching a Customer Engagement Centre to support a world famous Global automotive brand specialising in EV Mobility.
Our client is the first Car Enterprise to switch to 100% Electric and aims to transform into a leading player in urban premium electric and connected mobility and aiming to introduce an innovative business model, that is customer-centric, data-driven, direct-to-customer & will have an agent-based sales model
The role in our organisation
Conduent is hiring a dedicated Social Media Community Management Team to provide support within this multilingual Customer Engagement Centre. Based in our newly renovated office space in Lodz, you will receive full professional training on the skills, knowledge and brand awareness for this position. We are seeking Associates to work in English and/or German language specifically.
The Customer Engagement Centre operates on a shift rotation between 10:00 and 22:00 Monday to Sunday and for 40 hours per week.
If you are passionate about social media and customer engagement and are interested to spend your working day interacting with customers about this premium international automotive brand, we would love to hear from you soon!
Key Components to Success
Within the Customer Engagement Centre you will embrace Conduentâ€™s Core Values, using these to excel in your work and exceed our clientsâ€™ expectations.
The Conduent Core Values guide how we think, act and make decisions.
â€¢ Drive Client Success
â€¢ Deliver with Quality and personal accountability
â€¢ Be open and Inclusive
â€¢ Communicate with Purpose
â€¢ Be a good teammate
â€¢ Be Conduent Proud and act with humility
Culture
Located in the third biggest city in Poland our Associates in Lodz support customers in 20 different countries in 14 different languages. Lodz is a cosmopolitan city with universities, museums and a growing arts sector. Lodz has developed into a hub for many global businesses, proving itself to be a fantastic location for talented employees. Our Associates provide integral services to our clients within Finance, Accountancy and Procurement, Customer Experience, Mailroom and Scanning, Human Resources and Service Desk.
We are proud of more than 200 highly qualified workforce, most Associates have a university degree and are bilingual. Constantly investing in our workforce Associates have access to extensive learning platforms, we offer a career opportunity to those seeking to develop and consistently seek to ensure Conduent is the employer of choice in Lodz.

L.E.K.â€™s Transport and Logistics Practice is pursuing an ambitious growth strategy across the European region. As one of our most dynamic and fastest growing practice areas, Transport and Logistics has a client base that features some of the biggest and most innovative names in the sector, covering multiple modes of transportation (air, ferry, rail, bus, coach, micro-mobility), transport technology, logistics operations and software, new mobility platforms, and the enablers that ensure passengers and goods get to where they need to be efficiently and profitably.
To achieve our growth objectives, we will continue to enrich our expertise, develop and launch new service lines to our clients, increase collaboration and coordination within the region and with Transport teams around the world, and attract and promote the best talent.
Reporting to the European sector lead, interfacing directly with other sector partners, and working closely with colleagues on the European Commercial Team, the European Transport and Logistics Sector Specialist role is central to these goals. The role is the principal point of expertise about our Transport practice in Europe, its experience and services, and how they relate to client organisations. The Sector Specialist will provide critical input to marketing and demand generation activity, client proposals, client relationship management, and overall sector strategy and management. This position will be based in our rapidly growing and entrepreneurial Wroclaw, Poland office, and work closely with colleagues across the European region and indeed globally, with periodic travel to collaborate with the team in-person.
The ideal candidate will be driven and proactive, highly organised and a natural communicator, with an understanding of the consulting industry and a strong desire to take an active role in the development of the practice capabilities and new business opportunities.

GATES POLSKA Sp. z o.o.
WHY GATES?
Founded in 1911 in Denver, Colorado, Gates is publicly traded on the NYSE. While we might operate in a vast amount of time zones we operate as 'One Gates' and have a common goal of pushing the boundaries of materials science. We invest in our people, bringing real-world experience that enables us to solve our customers" diverse challenges of today and anticipate those of tomorrow.
While we expect the best we also want to give you the best. That's why at Gates we provide an environment where people can succeed from our policy of 'Dress for your Day' (yes - that means you can wear jeans), health club reimbursement, to our ownership of your work/life balance and more. Visit www.gates.com/careers to learn more.
WORK ENVIROMENT
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools, or controls; and talk or hear. The employee is occasionally required to stand, walk, and reach with hands and arms. The employee must frequently lift and/or move up to 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision. Must be able to work in an office or manufacturing environment.
Gates is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer and is committed to ensuring equal employment opportunities for all job applicants and employees. Employment decisions are based upon job-related reasons regardless of race, sex, color, religion, age, disability, pregnancy, citizenship, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, genetic information, marital status, or any other consideration defined by law.

The American School of Warsaw
The American School of Warsaw is an independent not for profit school that is sponsored by the Office of Overseas Schools. The New England Association of Schools and Colleges and the Council of International Schools have accredited the school since 1987. The school has also been an accredited IB DP School since 1994. We have also received formal notification from the IB that we are now recognized as an IB candidate school for the Middle Years Programme as of 14 June 2016 and Primary Years Programme as of 30 May 2016.
Established in 1953, we are proud to be the oldest international school in Warsaw, offering an American-based curriculum with an international perspective for 980 students, aged 3-18. We have students from over 50 nations, and a faculty of more than 100 highly qualified mostly oversees-hired educators. By respecting the diversity of our employees, we promote the creation of an environment in which all individuals can utilize their talents to the fullest while working together for the best of our community. We are seeking candidates who integrate well with a diverse population and embrace the opportunities of living in a truly international setting.

About Us
Ajax Systems, the most awarded wireless security system provider in Europe, is in search of a professional and dedicated individual for the role of HR Operations Specialist, who is willing to collaborate in the team, be passionate about employee relationships, growing HR processes and team development in general.
Our people are at the center of what we do. The role of the HR Operations Specialist is to ensure that we attract, retain and develop our people. You will be involved in strategic and operational impact in making Ajax the best place to work.
Started as an ambitious idea, Ajax System now provides more than 1 million users in 120 countries with protection against the most common threats.
Every year we show a multiple increase in both the number of teams and the number of users worldwide. Ajax Systems has two manufacturers based in Ukraine, a big R&D office and an extremely fast-growing global business unit team.
Join our team to work on Europe's most titled wireless security system.

https://www.pracuj.pl/praca/r-d-site-man.about_us:
About Us
Our foreign client Infoniqa is getting ready to open the new office in KrakÃ³w. As a partner, we are looking for new employees for them.
About company:
Infoniqa is a fast-growing software company located in Austria that stands for innovative, cloud-based solutions for HR processes. For over 30 years, Infoniqa has supported HR departments in all industries - whether with intuitive software tools, precise advice or practical services.
Infoniqa is a specialist in all areas of HR work and the German market leader for payroll accounting that is fully integrated in Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central. The solutions include: HR Software, BPO Service, Payroll, Personnel Management, Time Recording, Time Management, Workforce Planning, eLearning, Talent Management, Education Management, Personnel Development, and Self Service.
Over 2.5 million employees in Austria, Germany and Switzerland rely on Infoniqa's expertise in payroll accounting, personnel management and time recording. As a holistic solution partner in the personnel area, Infoniqa also supports companies in outsourcing, with individual HR advice, practical training and competent support.
The R&D Site Manager (Software) will be running the Infoniqa R&D Site @ Krakow (Poland), taking care of the local Software Engineering Teams and making sure that the collaboration with other R&D Sites (Austria, Germany, Switzerland) are well establish and work efficiently.
This also implicates involvement in project work, establishment and optimization of agile engineering processes and helping with the according deliveries at either technical, functional or organizational level.
The successful candidate is used to be part of an international Engineering Team, is passionate about people, technology and management in dynamic and challenging environments.
If you are interested contact NMI ERP via apply button.

https://www.pracuj.pl/praca/sourcing-and.about_us:
About Us
We are looking for an experienced candidate with strong interest in product development, sourcing and merchandising. You are a commercial thinker driven by solid tradesmanship with the goal to find the most cost optimal solution. At the same time you possess a natural talent for building mutual trust and long-term partnerships with clients and vendors. Working in a organized way comes easy to you and you thrive putting structure to chaos.
Do you want to work with democratic furniture where our Scandinavian roots, flat hierarchy and love for good design plays a vital role?
We are a 5 year old wholesale company primarily focused on upholstered furniture sourced throughout Poland. We cooperate with clients from across Europe but with Germany as our core market. Our company was founded by industry specialist from Scandinavia and is a sister company of one of EuropÂ´s largest furniture sourcing agencies. The company itself employs 6 people, however being part of a larger organization we are about 25 people in total split across administration, sourcing, graphics, design and quality assurance. Our modern offices are based MokotÃ³w in Warsaw with easy access to the whole city.
We are currently experiencing a massive growth and have a clear strategy in place to grow and expand significantly in the coming years.
As our new Merchandising and Sourcing Specialist you will play a decisive role in contributing to the overall success of the business by effectively managing the whole portfolio of products. In close cooperation with our sales agents and internal teams you will be responsible for getting new products from initial idea phase to launch with clients. The scope of tasks ranges very broadly and you will be heading not only development of new products, but also sourcing of new vendors as well as day-to-day operational tasks including follow-ups on vendors performance, item profitability analysis, preparation of marketing materials and much more.
We expect you are motivated by working in a small company where you have the opportunity to engage with a varied set of tasks and responsibilities whilst also have direct impact the decision making and the freedom to initiate good ideas.
